title: Do you think Kurt Cobain was a good vocalist? - Quora

response.answer_text: I respectfully disagree with most of the people on this thread. I think Kurt Cobain was an amazing vocalist. I think traditionally when we say that word we often times measure it with power and how high a singer can go in their range but not the power and emotion vocals can carry. I’ve seen a bunch of covers for smells like teen spirit and lithium and not one blew me away. I think Kurt’s vocals was incredible because not only did anyone else sound like him but the type of power, anguish and haunting melodic sirens can’t ever be emulated. I often think sometimes we’ve grown accustomed to vocals that sound too perfect or too good when it’s been synthesized cause that’s how we’ve been trained to hear them. But I think Kurt was an incredible vocalist and his voice alone United a generation.

I don’t think he was a remarkable vocalist, but he achieved what he set out to do. He was able to convey the content of his songs by singing them in a legible manner. There are many singers who stumble with that, I’m not sure Kurt ever had any vocal lessons? In answer to your question yeah he was an alright vocalist. There are probably several thousand folks singing in bars across the world who are at least Kurt’s equal in vocals. Someone should be asking about them, as Kurt will sing no more. No disrespect toward Kurt or his fans, but he’s been dead for close to 25 years now, what about the live ones singing with relevance? Just my thoughts. Thanks! Robert

Does a bear shit in the woods? Kurt while unconventional , was a phenomenal vocalist . Ever seen a cover band or anyone really do a decent attempt? He's a one of a kind singer , like Freddie Mercury , only instead of being operatic , he's sings the lungs out of his chest like they're going to burst.

YES! All Kurt Cobain had to be was the vocalist for Nirvana. And he did an excellent job doing that. The songs were written by him, for his poor tortured soul to chew on and spit out at the world. Kurt poured his heart into those songs, and sang about the life and times of chasing the high, as well as the low. Like a character in a Ginsberg novel. Fair Accompli..
He didn't always sing in a way that is healthy for his vocal chords…but it's f Cobain there is no discussion, he is amazing
